elements.title: recorded songs for at least 35 films and television soundtracks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Angeline Quinto (pictured) has recorded songs for at least 35 films and television soundtracks in the Philippines?

elements.title: books bound in human skin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that known books bound in human skin include a highwayman's memoirs bound in his own skin, a novel about a man being left by his lesbian wife, and a BDSM erotic poem?

elements.title: Scott Reppert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that College Football Hall of Fame inductee Scott Reppert was a three-time Little All-American at running back and an Academic All-American in the classroom?

elements.title: Hotel Brexton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Hotel Brexton in Baltimore was once home to Wallis Simpson, the American divorcée who married Edward VIII?

elements.title: Kharayeb (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that archaeological excavations in the historic town of Kharayeb revealed a rural settlement with a complex system of cisterns and a Phoenician temple?

elements.title: 1943 Football League War Cup final (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to sportswriter Jon Henderson, the 1943 Football League War Cup final was "widely regarded as the greatest club football match of the war"?

elements.title: Rhian Teasdale (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Rhian Teasdale and Hester Chambers formed Wet Leg on a Ferris wheel?

elements.title: his mug shot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that within 90 minutes of Donald Trump's release from jail, his 2024 presidential campaign began using his mug shot on merchandise?
